title: [NOTICE] Players may be experiencing ping spikes with iiNet
body:
Hey guys just thought I would give you a heads up, over the past few months I have been getting ping spikes like no other, I didn't think it had anything to do with Riots game servers since no one else was lagging.

A few weeks past since that time and I was playing with a friend on a different exchange completely who is also an iiNet ADSL 2+ Customer, at almost the same times we would be getting ping spikes. I decided to do a little digging and contact them, turns out I was right in my theory that somewhere along the connection to Riots data center is a massive bottle-neck or faulty connection.

If you run a traceroute to the OCE datacenter you will find towards the end between iiNets last HOP and Riots game servers a massive ping spike almost identical to what I was getting in games.

I am now in the process of moving ISP's and for now I would advise you to do the same if you're getting any ping issues in games.

PS: If you have any feedback or similar experiences leave them here.

-SumCoolAid

replies.body:
Hey Cochese hope all has been well with you mate. iiNet has much larger issues in than getting to your data center how ever I will get this off to you guys, It wont be much help though.

-SumCoolAid

Thanks for alerting us to this here. It's not easy to track down every players bottleneck. We will reach out to iiNet to see if there is something we can do to help clear up that route.

Can you please send that traceroute to: ocelivereports@riotgames.com

Thanks for your post here!
